I have a slight edge in development and use it to seize the open file. Now the game really begins, as the preliminaries are over.
moves.15. Nc4 Bxc4: I was expecting 16 PxB QxP 17 QxQ BxQ 18 R moves, with a Pawn ahead and a long endgame to come where I have a slight, possibly winning, advantage.
moves.16. b4 Bb6: I'm not sure why my opponent didn't simply recapture the piece but I'll be happy. 16... BxR winning the Exchange was even stronger than the text but I simply overlooked it.
moves.17. Rfe1 Rd3: Once again focusing on the QBP.
moves.18. Rad1 Qxc3: I augment my material advantage by one Pawn.
moves.19. Qxc3 Rxc3: My opponent should have kept the Queens on the board with some such move as 19 Q-N1. With my material advantage any simplifications help me.
moves.21. Re3 Rxe3: I gladly exchange a pair of Rooks, especially since...
moves.22. fxe3 Bxe3+: ... I win another Pawn into the bargain...
moves.23. Kh1 Bxd2: ...and get to exchange off another set of minors to boot!
moves.24. Rxd2 Bc4: With the material flying off the board fast and furious, my advantage has become greatly augmented. Now it's an easy win.
moves.25. Rd4 Bb5: Securing the B in a safe spot.
moves.26. g3 f6: Planning to tuck my K where it can't be checked.
moves.29. Rxc7 Rxb4: ...and now 2 loose Pawns. As 30 RxQNP is met by 30... B-B8 ch! 31 KxB RxR, White graciously resigns.
